title: COVID-19 Contact Tracing Form & Request RATS
description:
Two public-facing, high-traffic applications built in a tight timeframe as part of the New Zealand Government’s COVID-19 response.
- Built a multitude of form components to WCAG 2.1
- Defined a pattern to generate a complex multi-step form wizard
- Collaborated with the in-house UX/UI team to deliver a consistent and efficiently-developed end product

title: Goldie Wealth
description:
A front-end application built to face and support the back-end trading engine.
- Defined core user tasks
- Created user flows and wireframes
- Produced a clickable prototype
- Worked closely with the brand and strategy teams involved
- Sole front-end developer that built the React/TypeScript SPA
- Provided guidance on building the statically generated marketing site

title: Lighthouse Funds
description:
A brochureware site built using the [JAMstack approach](https://abletech.nz/article/lighthouse-funds-going-retail-part-1/) with Next.js, Netlify and Prismic.
- Selected appropriate technologies based on business requirements
- Integrated with a number of third party services
- Worked closely with the stakeholders and design team to deliver the site in the agreed timeframe

title: Livestock Improvement Corporation
description:
Suite of public and internal-facing micro front-ends integrated with back-end microservices, replacing legacy systems.
 - Replaced an MVP Ruby/Rails front-end with a React front-end
- Contributed extensively to the private package library for shared React components
- Implemented a “Three-Amigos” approach with the product owner and design team to solve design problems efficiently.

title: AED Locations
description: Rebuilt and streamlined the existing AED Locations web application.

title: Addressfinder Suggest
description: Built and shipped AddressFinder's 'Suggest' feature to support crowd sourced data corrections.
